problem_text: This is a GeomVerse problem. If the arc length of the ABC sector is 17.99 and the diagonal of the BDEC rectangle is 25, compute the degree of the CBA angle. Assume $\pi=3.14$. Round computations to 2 decimal places.
code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.patches as patches
import numpy as np

# Coordinates
A = (16292.76, 16757.28)
B = (34.23, 34.23)
C = (34.23, 23358.04)
D = (-8965.77, 34.23)
E = (-8965.77, 23358.04)

# Create figure and axis
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 10))

# Draw the cyan sector (B, A, C)
radius = 23358.04
start_angle = np.degrees(np.arctan2(A[1] - B[1], A[0] - B[0]))
end_angle = np.degrees(np.arctan2(C[1] - B[1], C[0] - B[0]))

if start_angle > end_angle:
    end_angle += 360

cyan_sector = patches.Wedge(
    center=B,
    r=radius,
    theta1=start_angle,
    theta2=end_angle,
    facecolor="cyan",
    edgecolor="black",
    alpha=0.6
)
ax.add_patch(cyan_sector)

# Draw the blue rectangle (B, D, E, C)
blue_rectangle = patches.Polygon([B, D, E, C], closed=True, color="blue", alpha=0.6)
ax.add_patch(blue_rectangle)

# Draw right-angle markers
def draw_right_angle(ax, p1, p2, p3, size=1.0, color="gray", alpha=0.8):
    '''Draw a right-angle marker at the corner defined by p1, p2, and p3.'''
    v1 = np.array(p1) - np.array(p2)
    v2 = np.array(p3) - np.array(p2)
    v1 = v1 / np.linalg.norm(v1) * size
    v2 = v2 / np.linalg.norm(v2) * size
    marker = patches.Polygon(
        [p2, p2 + v1, p2 + v1 + v2, p2 + v2],
        closed=True,
        facecolor=color,
        edgecolor=None,
        alpha=alpha
    )
    ax.add_patch(marker)

# Add right-angle markers
draw_right_angle(ax, B, D, E)
draw_right_angle(ax, D, E, C)
draw_right_angle(ax, E, C, B)
draw_right_angle(ax, C, B, D)

# Add labels
ax.text(A[0], A[1], "A", fontsize=16, ha="left", va="bottom")
ax.text(B[0], B[1], "B", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="top")
ax.text(C[0], C[1], "C", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="bottom")
ax.text(D[0], D[1], "D", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="top")
ax.text(E[0], E[1], "E", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="bottom")

# -- LENGTH ANNOTATION -- #
ax.text((B[0] + D[0]) / 2, (B[1] + D[1]) / 2, "9", fontsize=16, ha="center", va="top")

# Configure the plot
ax.set_xlim(-14965.77, 25034.23)
ax.set_ylim(-4965.77, 30034.23)
ax.set_aspect("equal")
ax.axis("off")

# Show the plot
plt.show()

ext_info.cot: The diagonal of the BDEC rectangle is 25 and the length of its BD side is 9, so the length of the BC side is $\sqrt{25^2 - 9^2} = \sqrt{625 - 81} = \sqrt{544} = 23.32$. The BC radius of the ABC sector is 23.32 and the arc length is 17.99. So the CBA angle can be computed as $\frac{ArcLength}{2 \pi r} * 360 = \frac{17.99}{2 \pi * 23.32} * 360 = \frac{17.99}{146.45} * 360 = 0.12 * 360 = 43.2$. Therefore the final answer is 43.2.
